Functions¶

Documentation on non-class-bound Functions

tools.createToolTip(widget, text)¶

The function used to create a tool tip, internally creates a :py:class:’ToolTip’ object and binds the corresponding keys.

Parameters:
  • widget (Widget) – the Widget the tooltip should be shown for
  • text (str) – The message to show in the tooltip
Polygon.perpendicular(a)¶

Returns a numpy array that’s orthongonal to the param

Parameters:a – Numpy array
Polygon.getIntersection(a1, a2, b1, b2)¶

Retrieves the point of interesection of two lines given two points on each line.

Parameters:
  • a2 (a1,) – First point
  • b2 (b1,) – Second point
Polygon.isInteresecting(a1, a2, b1, b2)¶

Determines if two line segments are intersecting by checking if the point of intersection exists on the line segments

Parameters:
  • a2 (a1,) – The endpoints of the first line segment
  • b2 (b1,) – The endpoints of the second line segment
Polygon.tupleToNpArray(pair)¶

Returns an array of the tuple passed

Parameters:pair – A tuple
Polygon.npArrayToTuple(array)¶

Returns a tuple of the array passed

Parameters:array – The array passed
